acknowledgments.summary: Siemens reported this vulnerability to CISA.

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an attacker to gain read and write access to the related TeamCenter station.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this vulnerability. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage on us-cert.gov. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage on us-cert.gov in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

references.summary: ICS Advisory ICSA-19-281-04 - Web Scraped Version

notes.text: An authenticated remote attacker could recover a password over Port 1434/TCP, which may be used to gain read/write access to the related TeamCenter station.CVE-2019-13929 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 6.8 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:N/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Siemens recommends users update to Version 1.3, which can be obtained from a Siemens account manager.
Siemens has identified the following specific workarounds and mitigations users can apply to reduce the risk:

As a general security measure, Siemens strongly recommends protecting network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms. In order to operate the devices in a protected IT environment, Siemens recommends configuring the environment according to Siemens’ operational guidelines for Industrial Security, and following the recommendations in the product manuals.
Additional information on Industrial Security by Siemens can be found at: https://www.siemens.com/industrialsecurity
For more information on this vulnerability and more detailed mitigation instructions, please see Siemens security advisory SSA-984700 at the following location: http://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories
